author: Ben Otto
title: Key Islamic State Ally Indicted for Plotting Attacks From Prison Cell
text:
JAKARTA, Indonesia—A veteran terrorist leader was indicted Thursday for ordering attacks from his prison cell, including a deadly assault in the capital that showed Islamic State had spread to the world’s most-populous Muslim-majority country.
Aman Abdurrahman, leader of a network aligned with Islamic State called Jamaah Ansharut Daulah, could face the death penalty for his alleged crimes, which involve inciting followers to commit multiple acts of terrorism in the Southeast Asian nation since late 2015.
